verbatim_example: My thinking is still foggy from the Kratom, but it doesn't do much in regards to anxiety. Right now I imagine that the benzo W/Ds are still most of it,
I didn't sleep for a 4 day span in the past 2 weeks. I get so easily over-whelmed, and that feeling is really magnified when I stop dosing.
Going outside feels so terrifying, esp when I am physically shaking and in constant cold sweats.
I thought the benzo withdrawals kicked in that first week but now that I look back I think it was primarily opiate withdrawals.
The withdrawal was really intense, I was stuck to my apartment for almost the entire 3 weeks.
I'd usually take 2 and snort a half of one for a fast, hard come up and a pretty long high.
I am in the thick of wd.
no shitting water, no puking, no seizures (from benzo wd), no sweats

I am scared bc I know I will want to use.
I am happy to be here, sober .

But not like opiates high (except for the puking); it was like I did a fat line of coke .

Still have the morning GI lingering around but the malaise is still the biggest pain in the ass.
I still blow up the bathroom in the morning but it doesn't persist all day.
I get these random flashes of old feelings that shoot through me for a few seconds-minutes. I try to slow down in those moments to actually feel some shit.
it hit me like a fuckin sack of bricks... started pouring sweat, plotting and rationalizing all the ways I could get around this security blanket that I've created,
Yesterday went pretty well other than a few cases of the clammy sweats.
Yesterday was okay minus a crazy afternoon episode of the sweats. I fuckin hate that feeling.
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
Sunday morning the fog rolled back in. Emotional, tons of GI issues, anxiety sweats, depressed, stir crazy, irritable, restless. Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.

can't sleep... but I'm happy I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would.
